definition[0]: an occasion when something suddenly breaks apart or bursts
example[0]: the rupture of a blood vessel
definition[1]: a situation in which two countries, groups of people etc suddenly disagree and often end their relationship with each other
example[1]: The eleventh century saw the formal rupture between East and West.
example[2]: The rupture with his father was absolute.
definition[2]: a medical condition in which an organ of the body, especially one near the abdomen, sticks out through the wall of muscle that normally surrounds it
definition[3]: to break or burst, or to make something break or burst
example[3]: The pipe will rupture at its weakest point.
example[4]: His liver was ruptured when a brick wall collapsed on him.
definition[4]: to damage good relations between people or a peaceful situation
example[5]: The noise ruptured the tranquility of the afternoon.
